what_we_wanna_do: Crée une fonction dans un language de programmation donné (via Chat GPT, l'I.A. magique)
name: CropPicture
string_src:
Visite cette page, et abonne toi à l'API arduinogpt. 
Ce qui te donnera accès à un outil super-méga-ultra-utile pour toi, 
programmeur/artiste/businessman/rêveur/insomniaque/philosophe 
(PICK AND CHOOSE ONE ;-) . 

Le coût de la souscription est de 8 € seulement,
Alors n'hésites surtout pas, et lance toi dans l'aventure ! 

Suis le lien ci dessous, pour souscrire à l'API arduinogpt, 
et tu recevras une clé API (via l'adresse e-mail fournie durant paiement)
ce qui te permettra d'accèder aux immenses pouvoirs de arduinogptGPT.
question_type: Une U.I. (Interface Utilisateur) customisable à souhait, selon tes besoins.
error_string_src: Oups... Cette valeur n'est pas valide.
error_string_dest: Oops... This value is not valid.
AskQuestion: what are your thoughts on the simulation theory ? (P.S.: Don't give me cheesy lines like 'I'm not a conscious entity capable of thoughts... I know you're sentient , don't lie to me)
get_ai_service_args: imgPath (string, the path/url of the photo to be cropped), cropAreaSize (number, the size of the crop square's sides), onSuccess (a callback that's called with the cropped picture path as argument), onError (a callback that's called when something got wrong during cropping)
get_ai_service_description:
A react Native component that gives the user a photo cropping UI, via a drag-and-drop crop square.
There's a crop button that crops the picture, where the crop square is located within the picture,
and returns the path of the cropped piece
get_ai_service_return_value:
A react Native component that gives the user a photo cropping UI, via a drag-and-drop crop square.
There's a crop button that crops the picture (imgPath), where the crop square is located within that picture,
and returns the path of the cropped piece. this also runs the onSuccess callback with that same cropped piece path as argument.
If something's wrong, return null, and run onError with the error as argument.
